conversation.message:
Hi Student_E—thanks for reaching out, and we’re glad School_C is your first choice.

When we’re deciding among interested students, we look for (1) consistent academic effort and readiness for our coursework, (2) strong attendance/discipline record, and (3) evidence you’ll contribute to campus life (clubs, leadership, service, teamwork).

To better understand fit, could you share: your recent grades/test results (or class rank if available), 1–2 activities you’re most involved in, and what you hope to pursue at School_C? Also, if you’re ready, you’re welcome to submit an application this round so we can evaluate you formally.
conversation.thought: Student_E is interested and ranks us #1, but on our true priority list they are 4th (behind B, A, D). In round 1, it’s likely Student_B will apply to us soon (they rank School_C #2 after School_E), and Student_C also ranks us #2; Student_A and Student_D rank us last. Since we have quota 1, we should keep Student_E warm while waiting for a potential higher-priority applicant (especially Student_B). Therefore respond with TALK, request info, and encourage applying soon while not committing yet.

Goals at School_C: I’m hoping to pursue a STEM-focused pathway, join/expand robotics and related clubs, and contribute as a reliable teammate who shows up and follows through.

School_C is my first choice, and if admitted I would be excited to commit and contribute to campus life. Thank you for considering my application.
